nutrientSynergies.description: Nutrients that work together and should be consumed together for optimal absorption and function

synergies.name: Bone Health Trio
synergies.mechanism: Vitamin D increases calcium absorption. Vitamin K2 directs calcium to bones (not arteries). Magnesium activates vitamin D and supports bone mineralization.
recommendations: Take vitamin D with calcium-rich meal
Ensure K2 intake when supplementing calcium/D
Adequate magnesium prevents calcium from depositing in soft tissues

synergies.name: Iron Absorption Complex
synergies.mechanism: Vitamin C converts non-heme iron to more absorbable form. Copper is required for iron metabolism and hemoglobin synthesis.
enhancers: Vitamin C (25mg+ per meal with iron)
Meat/fish/poultry factor (even small amounts enhance plant iron)
inhibitors: Tannins (tea, coffee - wait 1-2 hours after meals)
recommendations: Pair plant iron sources with vitamin C foods
Avoid calcium supplements with iron-rich meals
Cook in cast iron for additional iron
Don't drink tea/coffee with meals

synergies.name: Fat-Soluble Vitamin Complex
synergies.mechanism: Vitamins A, D, E, K require dietary fat for absorption. They also work synergistically - excess of one can deplete others.

optimalRatios.vitaminA_to_D: 1000-2000 IU vitamin A per 1000 IU vitamin D
optimalRatios.vitaminE_to_K: Maintain both in optimal range; no fixed ratio

recommendations: Consume fat-soluble vitamins with healthy fats (15g+ per meal)
Don't mega-dose single fat-soluble vitamin without others
Best sources provide multiple: liver (A, D, K), egg yolks (A, D, E, K)

synergies.name: B-Complex Synergy
synergies.mechanism: B vitamins work together in energy metabolism, neurotransmitter synthesis, and DNA methylation. Isolated B vitamins can create imbalances.
recommendations: Consume whole food sources providing full B-complex (eggs, meat, fish)
Folate and B12 work together in methylation - both needed
B6 enhances magnesium absorption

synergies.name: Antioxidant Network
synergies.mechanism: Antioxidants regenerate each other. Vitamin C recycles vitamin E. Selenium is cofactor for glutathione peroxidase. Zinc supports SOD enzyme.
recommendations: Consume variety of antioxidants from whole foods
Vitamin C regenerates oxidized vitamin E
Don't mega-dose single antioxidant

synergies.name: Zinc-Copper Balance
synergies.mechanism: Zinc and copper compete for absorption. High zinc can deplete copper and vice versa.
recommendations: Aim for 15mg zinc to 1.5mg copper
Oysters high in both zinc and copper (balanced)
Long-term zinc supplementation requires copper monitoring

synergies.name: Omega Balance
synergies.mechanism: Omega-6 and omega-3 compete for same enzymes. High omega-6 is inflammatory; omega-3 is anti-inflammatory.
recommendations: Reduce omega-6 sources (seed oils, grain-fed meat)
Increase omega-3 from fish, grass-fed meat, walnuts
Wild salmon provides ~2g omega-3 with minimal omega-6

synergies.name: Methylation Pathway
synergies.mechanism: Critical for DNA repair, neurotransmitter synthesis, detoxification. Requires activated forms of nutrients.
recommendations: Natural folate (not synthetic folic acid) from leafy greens, liver
B12 from animal sources only (vegans must supplement)
Choline from eggs (3-4 eggs provides optimal intake)
Those with MTHFR variants need extra methylated B vitamins

bioavailabilityFactors.description: Factors affecting how well nutrients are absorbed and utilized

heme_vs_nonheme.implication: Need 3-5x more plant iron than animal iron to meet requirements

factors.cooking_tip: Cast iron cookware can triple iron content in acidic foods

factors.timing: Spread throughout day - body can only absorb ~500mg at once

factors.note: Modern agriculture has depleted soil magnesium - even whole foods may be lower than historical values

food_vs_sun.sun_production: 10,000-25,000 IU in 20 min full-body sun exposure
food_vs_sun.food_sources_limited: Few foods naturally high (fatty fish, egg yolks)

factors.activation: Requires magnesium to convert to active form

K1_vs_K2.K2_sources: Fermented foods, grass-fed dairy, egg yolks, organ meats

factors.note: Government RDAs only address K1 for clotting, ignore K2 for cardiovascular/bone health

beta_carotene.note: Many people are poor converters of beta-carotene

factors.recommendation: Include preformed vitamin A from animal sources, don't rely solely on plant carotenoids

ALA.note: Cannot rely on plant omega-3 for EPA/DHA needs

EPA_DHA.recommendation: 3-4g combined EPA+DHA daily from whole food sources

synthetic_folic_acid.concerns: May accumulate unmetabolized, can mask B12 deficiency
synthetic_folic_acid.MTHFR_issue: 40% of population has MTHFR gene variant - poor folic acid metabolism

factors.recommendation: Obtain from whole foods; avoid fortified products with synthetic folic acid

antinutrients.description: Compounds in foods that can interfere with nutrient absorption. Many can be reduced through proper preparation.

compounds.name: Phytic Acid (Phytates)
compounds.effect: Binds to minerals (iron, zinc, calcium, magnesium) preventing absorption

reduction_methods.duration: 12-24 hours in warm water with acidic medium (lemon juice, whey)

reduction_methods.examples: Sourdough bread, fermented legumes, miso, tempeh

reduction_methods.effectiveness: Reduces 40-80%, also increases vitamin C and B vitamins

recommendations: Always soak grains and legumes before cooking
Choose fermented forms when possible (sourdough > regular bread)
Combine plant iron/zinc sources with animal sources for better absorption
Consume vitamin C with plant-based meals to counteract phytate effect on iron

compounds.name: Oxalates (Oxalic Acid)
compounds.effect: Binds calcium and iron, can contribute to kidney stones in susceptible individuals

reduction_methods.mechanism: Calcium binds oxalates in gut before absorption
reduction_methods.example: Eat spinach with cheese or yogurt

recommendations: Rotate greens - use kale, bok choy, collards (low oxalate) not just spinach
Boil high-oxalate greens and discard cooking water
Pair with calcium-rich foods
Limit if prone to kidney stones

compounds.name: Lectins
compounds.effect: Can damage gut lining, reduce nutrient absorption, cause digestive distress
compounds.critical_safety: NEVER eat raw or undercooked kidney beans - extremely high lectin content can cause severe poisoning
recommendations: Always soak legumes 12-24 hours, discard water
Pressure cook for maximum lectin reduction
Fermentation also effective (tempeh, miso)

compounds.name: Tannins
compounds.mechanism: Binds to non-heme iron, making it unavailable
compounds.impact: Cup of tea with meal can reduce iron absorption by 60-70%
recommendations: Don't drink tea or coffee within 1-2 hours of iron-rich meals
If anemic, avoid tannin-rich beverages with meals
Herbal teas (chamomile, peppermint) have lower tannins

compounds.name: Goitrogens
compounds.effect: Interfere with thyroid hormone production by blocking iodine uptake

reduction_methods.note: Heat inactivates enzyme that forms goitrogenic compounds

risk_assessment.low_risk: Normal consumption of cooked cruciferous vegetables by people with adequate iodine
risk_assessment.moderate_risk: Large amounts of raw cruciferous (e.g., daily green smoothies) + low iodine
risk_assessment.high_risk: Hypothyroid patients consuming large amounts of raw goitrogens

recommendations: Cook cruciferous vegetables (reduces goitrogens)
Ensure adequate iodine intake (fish, seaweed, eggs)
Moderate raw cruciferous intake
Those with thyroid issues should monitor intake

compounds.name: Protease Inhibitors
compounds.note: This is why raw egg whites are poorly digested vs cooked

foodCombinations.description: Strategic food pairings to maximize nutrient absorption

optimal_combinations.mechanism: Piperine in black pepper inhibits curcumin metabolism
Fat-soluble carotenoids need fat for absorption
Vitamin C counteracts phytates, enhances non-heme iron

optimal_combinations.benefit: Complete omega-3 and vitamin K synergy
optimal_combinations.mechanism: EPA/DHA from fish supports cardiovascular health, K2 directs calcium

optimal_combinations.benefit: Enhanced nutrient absorption from most nutrient-dense food
optimal_combinations.mechanism: Fermented foods improve gut health and nutrient uptake

combinations_to_avoid.recommendation: Separate by 2+ hours (e.g., don't take calcium supplement with iron-rich meal)
Wait 1-2 hours after meal before drinking tea/coffee

combinations_to_avoid.problem: Excess fiber can speed transit time, reducing absorption
combinations_to_avoid.recommendation: Don't take fat-soluble vitamin supplements with high-fiber bran cereal

circadianTiming.description: Optimal timing of nutrients based on circadian rhythms and metabolic processes

timing_recommendations.optimal_timing: Distributed throughout day, especially morning and post-activity
timing_recommendations.reasoning: Muscle protein synthesis occurs throughout day; 25-40g per meal maximizes synthesis
timing_recommendations.breakfast_importance: Morning protein intake supports muscle maintenance and satiety

timing_recommendations.reasoning: Evening carbs increase serotonin and melatonin, supporting sleep quality
timing_recommendations.insulin_sensitivity: Highest in morning, but evening carbs don't negatively impact most people

timing_recommendations.reasoning: Supports satiety, hormone production, fat-soluble vitamin absorption
timing_recommendations.note: Healthy fats don't spike insulin, good for sustained energy

timing_recommendations.reasoning: Can interfere with sleep if taken at night (activating hormone)
Energizing, may interfere with sleep if taken evening
timing_recommendations.food_sources: Naturally occur in morning foods (eggs, meat)
